<lname>Henry</lname> tipped for Fifa award

Fifa president <name>Sepp Blatter</name> hopes Arsenal's <name>Thierry Henry</name> will be named World Player of the Year on Monday.

<name>Henry</name> is on the Fifa shortlist with Barcelona's <lname>Ronaldinho</lname> and newly-crowned European Footballer of the Year, AC Milan's <name>Andriy Shevchenko</name>. <lname>Blatter</lname> said: "<lname>Henry</lname>, for me, is the personality on the field. He is the man who can run and organise the game." The winner of the accolade will be named at a glittering ceremony at Zurich's Opera house. The three shortlisted candidates for the women's award are <name>Mia Hamm</name> of the United States, Germany's <name>Birgit Prinz</name> and Brazilian youngster <name>Marta</name>.

<lname>Hamm</lname>, who recently retired - is looking to regain the women's award, which she lost last year to striker <lname>Prinz</lname>. Fifa has changed the panel of voters for this year's awards. Male and female captains of every national team will be able to vote, as well as their coaches.
